alert.note: Alert for Ventura (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 15 at 6:19AM PDT until March 15 at 6:11PM PDT by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 AM PDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Urban area and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southwest California, including the following county, Ventura. * WHEN...Until 800 AM PDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of Conejo Creek in Camarillo is occurring. Water has been reported across Ridge View Street near the intersection of Adohr Lane. Conejo Creek is continuing to rise this morning due to excess runoff from earlier and ongoing rainfall. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 615 AM PDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated an area of moderate to heavy rainfall across the warned area earlier. Between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Flooding is occurring along the Conejo Creek beginning near Leisure Village and near the intersection of Adohr Lane and Ridge View Street. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Camarillo. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
